ground_truth: Suddenly, everything rushes, and the crowd becomes a blur, causing a young woman to be lost in its wake. Now it's Edward who's frozen, helpless in time, as he checks in windows while cars pull out, searching for his fated love. Colossus is thumbing for a ride, and the last pickup truck stops to let him climb in back. As the truck pulls away, it passes a dejected Edward who believes he'll never find the girl, the love of his life. Amos leans over so Karl can sign a contract on his back and spots Edward walking back into the tent. Amos hands off the contract to a clown, and as Amos starts to walk away, Edward hurries to catch up with him, pointing to the bleachers where no backpack is to be found. Getting in front of Amos, Edward stops him, and Amos smiles, amused. Amos takes a long look at Edward, and ultimately, there's no way he can say no, so he shrugs, and Edward shakes Amos's hand before he can retract the offer. We move into a montage, where Edward is shown smiling nervously, his head tilted to the side, with it held in a massive lion's open mouth, whose sharp teeth are just poking his skin. If the lion flinches, Edward's life is in danger. The crowd applauds, making the lion antsy, which makes Edward even antsier. With his eyes droopy from lack of sleep, Edward mans the whirling amusement park ride and nods off, falling backward into the path of the spinning arms. One of the Hydra cars hits him square in the gut, throwing him up and away, sailing 200 feet through the air. Amos is walking past, stops, looks at the young man, and then finally walks away. We push in on Edward, enraptured by the concept. Edward shovels manure in the nastiest stables, preoccupied with his thoughts. In quiet reverie, he ponders his latest bit of information. A sudden explosion occurs as Edward is shot out of a giant cannon. Under a full moon, Edward walks up to a battered camper and is about to knock when he notices it's rocking significantly. Yet, Edward knocks anyway, and the rocking and moaning suddenly stop. A beat later, the door handle begins to rattle, seeming stuck. Edward turns the knob, and the door bursts open, knocking him down with a massive black dog, the biggest anyone has ever seen, with green glowing eyes and a lick of fire for a tongue. Edward wrestles with the beast as its mouth snaps at his throat. Blocking with an arm, Edward tries to push himself free, but the creature’s hands—holding tight instead of paws—prevent him.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Abruptly, all rushes, and the throng becomes a haze, causing a youthful woman to be misplaced in its wake. Now it's Edward who's immobilized, powerless in time, as he inspects in panes while vehicles draw out, seeking for his destined affection. Colossus is hitchhiking for a lift, and the last pickup lorry halts to let him climb in back. As the lorry pulls away, it passes a dispirited Edward who believes he'll never locate the girl, the love of his existence. Amos inclines over so Karl can endorse a agreement on his back and detects Edward strolling back into the shelter. Amos hands off the agreement to a jester, and as Amos begins to walk away, Edward hastens to catch up with him, pointing to the bleachers where no rucksack is to be found. Getting in front of Amos, Edward halts him, and Amos grins, entertained. Amos takes a prolonged look at Edward, and ultimately, there's no way he can say no, so he shrugs, and Edward shakes Amos's hand before he can withdraw the proposal. We shift into a montage, where Edward is shown grinning apprehensively, his head tilted to the side, with it held in a colossal lion's open mouth, whose sharp fangs are just piercing his skin. If the lion flinches, Edward's existence is in peril. The audience applauds, making the lion skittish, which makes Edward even more anxious. With his eyes droopy from deprivation of rest, Edward operates the whirling amusement park ride and nods off, tumbling backward into the path of the spinning limbs. One of the Hydra vehicles strikes him square in the abdomen, hurling him up and away, soaring 200 feet through the atmosphere. Amos is strolling past, pauses, observes the youthful man, and then finally walks away. We push in on Edward, captivated by the idea. Edward shovels dung in the nastiest stables, engrossed with his reflections. In serene contemplation, he considers his latest bit of information. A sudden detonation occurs as Edward is shot out of a giant cannon. Under a full moon, Edward walks up to a battered camper and is about to knock when he notices it's rocking considerably. Yet, Edward knocks nevertheless, and the rocking and moaning abruptly cease. A beat later, the door handle begins to rattle, seeming stuck. Edward turns the knob, and the door bursts open, knocking him down with a colossal black canine, the largest anyone has ever seen, with green glowing eyes and a flicker of fire for a tongue. Edward struggles with the beast as its mouth snaps at his throat. Blocking with an arm, Edward attempts to push himself free, but the creature’s hands—holding tight instead of paws—hinder him.

Amos is stopped by Edward getting in front of him, and he is smiled at, amused. A long look is taken at Edward by Amos, and ultimately, no way he can say no is found, so a shrug is given by him, and Edward is shaken hands with by Amos before the offer can be retracted. A montage is moved into, where Edward is shown smiling nervously, his head tilted to the side, with it held in a massive lion's open mouth, whose sharp teeth poke his skin. If the lion flinches, danger is posed to Edward’s life. The crowd applauds, making the lion antsy, which makes Edward even antsier. With his eyes droopy from lack of sleep, Edward mans the whirling amusement park ride and nods off, falling backward into the path of the spinning arms. He is hit square in the gut by one of the Hydra cars, and he is thrown up and away, sailing 200 feet through the air. Edward is walked past by Amos, who stops, looks at the young man, and then finally walks away. Edward is pushed in on, enraptured by the concept. Manure is shoveled by Edward in the nastiest stables, preoccupied with his thoughts. In quiet reverie, his latest bit of information is pondered by him. A sudden explosion occurs as a giant cannon shoots Edward out. Under a full moon, a battered camper is walked up to by Edward, and a knock is about to be delivered when he notices it rocking significantly. Yet, he knocks anyway, and the rocking and moaning stop suddenly. A beat later, the door handle is begun to be rattled, seeming stuck. The knob is turned by Edward, and the door bursts open, knocking him down with a massive black dog, the biggest anyone has ever seen, with green glowing eyes and a lick of fire for a tongue. The beast is wrestled with by Edward as its mouth snaps at his throat. Blocking with an arm, he tries to push himself free, but the creature’s hands—holding tight instead of paws—prevent his escape.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Suddenly, everything blurs, and a young woman is lost in the crowd. Edward, frozen in time, searches through windows as cars leave. Colossus thumbs a ride, climbing into a departing pickup, passing Edward, who fears he'll never find his love. Amos, helping Karl sign a contract, spots Edward entering a tent. Amos gives a contract to a clown and Edward, pointing to empty bleachers, stops Amos. Amos, amused, examines Edward and eventually agrees, shaking his hand. In a montage, Edward nervously smiles as a lion's mouth hovers near him. The crowd's applause agitates the lion and Edward. Sleep-deprived, Edward mans a ride but nods off and is struck by a Hydra car, launching him 200 feet. Amos observes him but walks away. Edward shovels manure, contemplating. Suddenly, he's shot from a cannon. Under a full moon, he approaches a rocking camper, knocks, and the motion stops. The door rattles, and when Edward opens it, a massive black dog with glowing green eyes and a fiery tongue bursts forth. Edward wrestles the beast, blocking its snapping jaws with his arm but struggles as it grips him with hands instead of paws.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Suddenly, everything blurs, causing a young woman to disappear. Edward stands frozen, helplessly searching for his love. Colossus hitches a ride, and Edward, believing he's lost her, walks dejectedly. Amos notices Edward returning to the tent. Edward catches up with Amos, pointing to missing bleachers, prompting Amos to smile and offer a contract, which Edward accepts. In a montage, Edward nervously places his head in a lion's mouth, risking injury. Sleep-deprived, he mans a ride, falls, and is struck by a Hydra car, soaring 200 feet. Amos briefly notices but walks away. Edward, lost in thought, shovels manure and considers recent revelations. Suddenly, he's shot from a cannon. Under a full moon, he approaches a rocking camper and knocks despite the noise stopping. The door bursts open, and Edward is tackled by a massive black dog with fiery features. Wrestling, Edward tries to fend off the beast's snapping mouth and tight grip.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Suddenly, in an unexpected and overwhelming rush, everything begins to move at a breakneck pace, and the once-clear crowd now becomes nothing more than a swirling blur. This causes a young woman to find herself lost and adrift in its confusing wake. Now, it is Edward who finds himself frozen, caught helpless in the relentless grasp of time. He diligently checks in shop windows while cars are pulling out, all the while desperately searching for his destined love. Meanwhile, Colossus is seen thumbing for a ride at the roadside, and the very last pickup truck on the street pulls over to let him climb into the back. As the truck drives away into the distance, it passes by an utterly dejected Edward, who is filled with the heartbreaking belief that he will never find the girl, the true love of his life. Nearby, Amos leans over so that Karl can use his back to sign a contract, and at the same time, he notices Edward walking back into the bustling tent. Amos promptly hands off the signed contract to a nearby clown and begins to walk away until Edward hurriedly catches up with him, pointing toward the bleachers where no backpack is to be found. Getting in front of Amos, Edward steps in to stop him, and Amos, entertained, smiles with amusement. Amos takes a long, lingering look at Edward, and ultimately realizes there is no reasonable way he can deny him, so he simply shrugs, and Edward seizes the moment to shake Amos's hand before any offer can be retracted. We transition into a vivid montage, where Edward is depicted standing nervously with a tentative smile, his head casually tilted to the side, but held precariously in the massive open mouth of a lion, whose sharp, pointed teeth gently poke at his skin. If the lion were to make any sudden movements, Edward's life would be in peril. The crowd erupts in applause, making the lion uneasy, which in turn makes Edward even more anxious. His eyes are droopy from a lack of sleep as he mans the whirling, dizzying amusement park ride and starts to nod off, eventually falling backward into the path of the fast-spinning arms. One of the Hydra cars hits him directly in the gut, sending him soaring up and away, flying 200 feet through the air. As Amos is walking past, he stops momentarily, glances at the young man, and then finally continues walking away. We focus in on Edward, who is utterly captivated by the concept. Edward finds himself shoveling manure in the nastiest of stables, deeply preoccupied with his own swirling thoughts. In a state of quiet reverie, he contemplates his latest piece of intriguing information. Suddenly, there is an explosion as Edward is propelled out of a giant cannon with great force. Under the light of a full moon, Edward approaches a battered camper and is on the verge of knocking when he notices it is rocking significantly. However, Edward decides to knock anyway, prompting the rocking and moaning to abruptly cease. A beat later, the door handle begins to rattle as if it is stuck. Edward turns the knob with determination, and the door bursts open, causing him to tumble backward and down to the ground as a massive black dog, the largest anyone has ever seen, leaps out. With green glowing eyes and a tongue like a lick of fire, the creature wrestles with Edward, its mouth snapping dangerously close to his throat. Blocking with one arm, Edward struggles to push himself free, but the creature’s hands—gripping tightly instead of bearing paws—prevent his escape.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: In a sudden and unexpected surge of activity, everything around them begins to move at an incredibly fast and dizzying pace. The once-distinct and easily recognizable crowd transforms into a chaotic, swirling blur of motion. This overwhelming change leaves a young woman feeling utterly lost and adrift, tangled in the confusing wake of her surroundings. At this moment, it is Edward who finds himself standing utterly still, trapped and frozen in the merciless and relentless grip of time. As he moves down the street, he carefully checks in each shop window while cars continuously pull out and drive away. All the while, he is desperately searching for his destined love. Meanwhile, at the side of the road, Colossus can be seen standing there, thumbing for a ride, hoping to catch a lift from any passerby. Finally, the last pickup truck on the now-deserted street comes to a halt, allowing him to climb into the back. As the truck disappears into the distance, it passes by a dejected Edward, who is filled with the heartbreaking belief and sorrowful conviction that he may never find the girl who is the true love of his life. Nearby, Amos is leaning over so that Karl can use his back as a makeshift table to sign a contract. At the same time, Amos notices Edward making his way back into the lively and bustling tent. Amos quickly hands off the signed contract to a nearby clown and begins to walk away until Edward, in a hurry, catches up to him. He points toward the bleachers, indicating that there is no backpack to be found. With a determined step, Edward moves in front of Amos to stop him. Amused, Amos smiles, entertained by the situation. He takes a long, lingering look at Edward, and ultimately there is no reasonable way he can deny him; with a simple shrug, Edward seizes the moment and shakes Amos's hand before any offer can be taken back. We then transition into a vivid and colorful montage, where Edward is shown standing nervously, wearing a tentative yet hopeful smile, his head tilted casually to the side, but caught in the gigantic, open jaws of a lion. The lion's sharp, pointed teeth gently press against his skin, creating tension, as any sudden movement from the lion could put Edward's life in grave danger. The crowd erupts into applause, which makes the lion uneasy and, in turn, makes Edward even more anxious. His eyes, heavy and droopy from a lack of sleep, blink slowly as he operates the whirling, dizzying amusement park ride. He begins to nod off, eventually falling backward into the path of the swiftly spinning arms. One of the Hydra cars hits him squarely in the gut, launching him high into the sky, where he soars a staggering 200 feet through the air. As Amos is walking past, he stops momentarily, glances at the young man, and then finally continues on his way. We focus in closely on Edward, who is utterly captivated by the entire concept. He finds himself laboring away, shoveling manure in the filthiest and most unpleasant of stables, deeply preoccupied and lost in his own swirling thoughts. In a quiet state of reverie, he reflects and contemplates this latest piece of intriguing information. Then, in an unexpected moment, there is a sudden explosion as Edward is launched out of a giant cannon with tremendous force. Underneath the soft glow of a full moon, Edward approaches a weathered and battered camper, on the verge of knocking on its door when he notices that it is rocking back and forth significantly. Nevertheless, Edward decides to knock, which causes the rocking and the accompanying moaning sounds to cease abruptly. A moment later, the door handle begins to rattle as if it is stuck. Edward turns the knob with firm determination, and the door bursts open, causing him to tumble backward and fall to the ground. As he hits the earth, a massive, imposing black dog, larger than any other he has ever seen, leaps out. With eyes glowing a vivid green and a tongue like a flicker of fire, the fierce creature wrestles with Edward, its mouth snapping dangerously close to his throat. Struggling to keep it at bay with one arm, Edward fights to push himself free, but the creature’s hands, gripping tightly and eerily human-like instead of bearing paws, prevent his escape.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Suddenly, the entire world seems to surge into motion around her, and the young woman finds herself swallowed by the swift-moving crowd, becoming lost in its relentless momentum. Meanwhile, Edward stands motionless, seemingly trapped in a moment of helplessness as he peers through the reflections in shop windows, his gaze darting anxiously beyond the shifting glass. As cars rhythmically move in and out of street lanes, each pulling away from the curb, Edward's eyes scan for the elusive figure of his destined love. In a different part of this whirlwind scene, Colossus extends a hitchhiker's thumb upwards, hoping for a ride, and success is met when the last pickup truck grinds to a halt, inviting him to clamber into its open back. The truck, with its new passenger, rumbles away, rolling past a despondent Edward, whose heart sinks with the belief that the love of his life has slipped irretrievably beyond his reach. Meanwhile, Amos bends over, creating a makeshift desk with his back so Karl can scrawl his signature on a contract. As his eyes survey the surroundings, Amos catches sight of Edward trudging back into the tent, fueling a flicker of curiosity. In a smooth, almost absent-minded motion, Amos passes the signed contract to a clown and pivots to leave, his feet just beginning to move. But Edward, driven by urgency, accelerates to intercept Amos, pointing emphatically toward the bleachers, pointing out the conspicuous absence of a backpack. Blocking Amos's path, Edward halts him, catching the older man's attention, which turns into a faint, amused smile. Amos scrutinizes Edward with an expression that reveals an internal debate, ultimately conceding as the corners of his mouth lift in a resigned shrug. Taking advantage of the moment, Edward seizes Amos's hand in a firm handshake, securing the promise before anything changes. We transition seamlessly into a montage, capturing Edward's expression marked by a blend of nervousness and resolve. His head is precariously cradled within the gaping jaws of a massive lion, its sharp teeth just grazing his skin, holding his life on a razor's edge should the creature twitch. The audience's applause reverberates, unsettling the lion and in turn, dialing up Edward's anxiety. Exhaustion drapes Edward's eyelids half-closed as he operates a chaotic amusement park ride. Fatigue overtakes him, and he drifts into a brief sleep, his body lurching backward only to be caught in the sweeping path of the ride's mechanized arms. With brutal accuracy, one of the Hydra cars slams into him, its force launching him violently, his body arcing dramatically through the air, traveling an astonishing 200 feet. As Amos stumbles upon the scene, he pauses, observing the young man's plight before deciding to move on. We delve deeper into Edward's consciousness, captivated by the never-ending swirl of concepts filling his thoughts. With each shovel thrust, Edward shifts manure in the foulest of stables, his mind lost in the analysis of recent revelations. An abrupt cacophony erupts as Edward is propelled from the barrel of a giant cannon, a spectacle of explosive power. Under the serene glow of a full moon, Edward approaches a dilapidated camper, intending to knock when he notices the unsettling sway of its structure. Despite this, he raps his knuckles on the surface, causing the movement and accompanying sounds to abruptly cease. After a moment of silence, the door handle quivers as if stuck before Edward turns it firmly, resulting in the door flying wide open. This action sends Edward tumbling to the ground, greeted by the unexpected and overwhelming presence of an enormous black dog, its eyes casting an eerie green glow and a fiery tongue flicking dangerously. Edward engages in a desperate struggle with the beast as its snapping jaws drive mercilessly towards his throat. He defends with an arm, attempting to pry himself loose, but the creature's strange, human-like hands grip him tightly, refusing to let him escape its grasp.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
Suddenly, the bustling crowd blurs past a young woman, leaving Edward frozen and helpless, searching through windows and passing cars for his destined love. Meanwhile, Colossus hitches a ride on a departing pickup truck, which drives past a dejected Edward, resigned to losing his true love. Nearby, Amos helps Karl sign a contract and notices Edward returning to the tent. After handing the contract to a clown, Amos starts to leave, prompting Edward to catch up and point out the missing backpack from the bleachers. Edward convinces Amos to offer him help with a handshake after a brief exchange. 

In a montage, Edward nervously shares the spotlight with a lion, its teeth grazing his skin while the crowd's applause makes the lion—and Edward—ansier. Exhausted, Edward operates a spinning amusement ride, briefly dozing off and getting launched by a Hydra car, flying 200 feet through the air. Amos witnesses the scene and walks away, leaving the enraptured Edward to ponder his thoughts while shoveling manure in the stable. Later, during a full moon, Edward approaches a camper to knock, noticing it rocking, but proceeds anyway. After knocking, the rocking stops and the door bursts open, unleashing a massive black dog with fiery features. A struggle ensues as Edward wrestles with the beast, blocking its snapping jaws with his arm while attempting to break free from its grip.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Suddenly, everything rushes, and the crowd becomes a blur, reminiscent of the chaotic scenes during a carnival's peak hours, causing a young woman to be lost in its wake. Now it's Edward who's frozen, helpless in time, as he checks in windows of the bustling bazaar while cars, typical of a busy festival night, pull out, searching for his fated love. Colossus, a nickname for the towering man known among travelers, is thumbing for a ride, and the last pickup truck, a dusty old Ford with faded paint, stops to let him climb in back. As the truck pulls away, it passes a dejected Edward who believes he'll never find the girl, the love of his life who vanished amidst the throng. Amos, a seasoned ringmaster with decades of experience, leans over so Karl can sign a contract on his back and spots Edward walking back into the tent where a circus performance recently concluded. Amos hands off the contract to a clown, part of a troupe known for their hilarious yet intricate acts, and as Amos starts to walk away, Edward hurries to catch up with him, pointing to the bleachers where no backpack is to be found, echoing an earlier mishap during a rehearsal. Getting in front of Amos, Edward stops him, and Amos smirks, amused by Edward's persistence. Amos takes a long look at Edward, assessing him with the keen eye of a judge, and ultimately, there's no way he can say no, so he shrugs, and Edward shakes Amos's hand before he can retract the offer. We move into a montage, where Edward is shown smiling nervously, his head tilted to the side, with it held in a massive lion's open mouth, a notorious trick in the show, whose sharp teeth are just poking his skin. If the lion, trained yet unpredictable, flinches, Edward's life is in danger. The crowd applauds, making the lion antsy, which makes Edward even antsier. With his eyes droopy from lack of sleep after a long night of carnival activities, Edward mans the whirling amusement park ride and nods off, falling backward into the path of the spinning arms. One of the Hydra cars, an attraction known for its dizzying speeds, hits him square in the gut, throwing him up and away, sailing 200 feet through the air. Amos is walking past, stops, looks at the young man enduring the chaos of circus life, and then finally walks away. We push in on Edward, enraptured by the concept of becoming part of this surreal world. Edward shovels manure in the nastiest stables, part of his grueling new duties, preoccupied with his thoughts. In quiet reverie, he ponders his latest bit of information learned from a retired performer. A sudden explosion occurs as Edward is shot out of a giant cannon, a thrilling stunt often used as a grand finale. Under a full moon, Edward walks up to a battered camper, a relic from the 1960s with patched-up windows, and is about to knock when he notices it's rocking significantly. Yet, Edward knocks anyway, and the rocking and moaning suddenly stop, indicating something peculiar inside. A beat later, the door handle begins to rattle, seeming stuck due to the old hinges. Edward turns the knob, and the door bursts open, knocking him down with a massive black dog, akin to legendary hellhounds of folklore, the biggest anyone has ever seen, with green glowing eyes and a lick of fire for a tongue. Edward wrestles with the beast as its mouth snaps at his throat. Blocking with an arm, Edward tries to push himself free, but the creature’s hands—eerily human-like and holding tight instead of paws—prevent him.

Now it is Edward who is frozen helpless in time as he checks in windows while cars pull out searching for his fated love. Colossus is thumbing for a ride and the last pickup truck stops to let him climb in back. As the truck pulls away it passes a dejected Edward who believes he will never find the girl the love of his life. Amos leans over so Karl can sign a contract on his back and spots Edward walking back into the tent. Amos hands off the contract to a clown and as Amos starts to walk away Edward hurries to catch up with him pointing to the bleachers where no backpack is to be found. Getting in front of Amos Edward stops him and Amos smiles amused. Amos takes a long look at Edward and ultimately there is no way he can say no so he shrugs and Edward shakes Amos's hand before he can retract the offer. We move into a montage where Edward is shown smiling nervously his head tilted to the side with it held in a massive lion's open mouth whose sharp teeth are just poking his skin. If the lion flinches Edward's life is in danger. The crowd applauds making the lion antsy which makes Edward even antsier. With his eyes droopy from lack of sleep Edward mans the whirling amusement park ride and nods off falling backward into the path of the spinning arms. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. One of the Hydra cars hits him square in the gut throwing him up and away sailing 200 feet through the air. Amos is walking past stops looks at the young man and then finally walks away. We push in on Edward enraptured by the concept. Edward shovels manure in the nastiest stables preoccupied with his thoughts. In quiet reverie he ponders his latest bit of information. A sudden explosion occurs as Edward is shot out of a giant cannon. Under a full moon Edward walks up to a battered camper and is about to knock when he notices it is rocking significantly. Yet Edward knocks anyway and the rocking and moaning suddenly stop. A beat later the door handle begins to rattle seeming stuck. Edward turns the knob and the door bursts open knocking him down with a massive black dog the biggest anyone has ever seen with green glowing eyes and a lick of fire for a tongue. Edward wrestles with the beast as its mouth snaps at his throat. Blocking with an arm Edward tries to push himself free but the creature’s hands—holding tight instead of paws—prevent him.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: Suddenly everything rushes and the crowd becomes a blur causing a young woman to be lost in its wake. Now it is Edward who is frozen helpless in time as he checks in windows while cars pull out searching for his fated love. Colossus is thumbing for a ride and the last pickup truck stops to let him climb in back. As the truck pulls away it passes a dejected Edward who believes he will never find the girl the love of his life. Amos leans over so Karl can sign a contract on his back and spots Edward walking back into the tent. Amos hands off the contract to a clown and as Amos starts to walk away Edward hurries to catch up with him pointing to the bleachers where no backpack is to be found. Getting in front of Amos Edward stops him and Amos smiles amused. Amos takes a long look at Edward and ultimately there is no way he can say no so he shrugs and Edward shakes Amos's hand before he can retract the offer. We move into a montage where Edward is shown smiling nervously his head tilted to the side with it held in a massive lion's open mouth whose sharp teeth are just poking his skin. If the lion flinches Edward's life is in danger. The crowd applauds making the lion antsy which makes Edward even antsier. With his eyes droopy from lack of sleep Edward mans the whirling amusement park ride and nods off falling backward into the path of the spinning arms. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. One of the Hydra cars hits him square in the gut throwing him up and away sailing 200 feet through the air. Amos is walking past stops looks at the young man and then finally walks away. We push in on Edward enraptured by the concept. Edward shovels manure in the nastiest stables preoccupied with his thoughts. In quiet reverie he ponders his latest bit of information. Yet Edward knocks anyway and the rocking and moaning suddenly stop. A beat later the door handle begins to rattle seeming stuck. Edward turns the knob and the door bursts open knocking him down with a massive black dog the biggest anyone has ever seen with green glowing eyes and a lick of fire for a tongue. Edward wrestles with the beast as its mouth snaps at his throat. Blocking with an arm Edward tries to push himself free but the creature’s hands—holding tight instead of paws—prevent him.

Now it's Colossus who's frozen, helpless in time, as he checks in windows while cars pull out, searching for his fated love. Edward is thumbing for a ride, and the last pickup truck stops to let him climb in back. As the truck pulls away, it passes a dejected Colossus who believes he'll never find the girl, the love of his life. The giant wolf leans over so Amos can sign a contract on his back and spots Colossus walking back into the tent. The giant wolf hands off the contract to a clown, and as the giant wolf starts to walk away, Colossus hurries to catch up with him, pointing to the bleachers where no backpack is to be found. Getting in front of the giant wolf, Colossus stops him, and the giant wolf smiles, amused. The giant wolf takes a long look at Colossus, and ultimately, there's no way he can say no, so he shrugs, and Colossus shakes the giant wolf's hand before he can retract the offer. We move into a montage, where Colossus is shown smiling nervously, his head tilted to the side, with it held in a massive dog's open mouth, whose sharp teeth are just poking his skin. If the dog flinches, Colossus's life is in danger. The crowd applauds, making the dog antsy, which makes Colossus even antsier. With his eyes droopy from lack of sleep, Colossus mans the whirling amusement park ride and nods off, falling backward into the path of the spinning arms. One of the Hydra cars hits him square in the gut, throwing him up and away, sailing 200 feet through the air. The giant wolf is walking past, stops, looks at the young man, and then finally walks away. We push in on Colossus, enraptured by the concept. Colossus shovels manure in the nastiest stables, preoccupied with his thoughts. In quiet reverie, he ponders his latest bit of information. A sudden explosion occurs as Colossus is shot out of a giant cannon. Under a full moon, Colossus walks up to a battered camper and is about to knock when he notices it's rocking significantly. Yet, Colossus knocks anyway, and the rocking and moaning suddenly stop. A beat later, the door handle begins to rattle, seeming stuck. Colossus turns the knob, and the door bursts open, knocking him down with a massive black octopus, the biggest anyone has ever seen, with green glowing eyes and a lick of fire for a tongue. Colossus wrestles with the beast as its mouth snaps at his throat. Blocking with an arm, Colossus tries to push himself free, but the creature’s hands—holding tight instead of paws—prevent him.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Suddenly, everything rushes, and the crowd becomes a blur, causing a young woman to be lost in its wake. Now it's Edward who's frozen, helpless in time, as he checks in mirrors while bicycles pull out, searching for his fated love. Colossus is thumbing for a ride, and the last sedan stops to let him climb in back. As the sedan pulls away, it passes a dejected Edward who believes he'll never find the girl, the love of his life. Amos leans over so Karl can sign a menu on his back and spots Edward walking back into the cabin. Amos hands off the menu to a painter, and as Amos starts to walk away, Edward hurries to catch up with him, pointing to the benches where no suitcase is to be found. Getting in front of Amos, Edward stops him, and Amos smiles, amused. Amos takes a long look at Edward, and ultimately, there's no way he can say no, so he shrugs, and Edward shakes Amos's hand before he can retract the offer. We move into a montage, where Edward is shown smiling nervously, his head tilted to the side, with it held in a massive eagle's open beak, whose sharp talons are just poking his skin. If the eagle flinches, Edward's life is in danger. The audience applauds, making the eagle antsy, which makes Edward even antsier. With his eyes droopy from lack of sleep, Edward mans the whirling ferris wheel and nods off, falling backward into the path of the spinning seats. One of the chariots hits him square in the gut, throwing him up and away, sailing 200 feet through the air. Amos is walking past, stops, looks at the young man, and then finally walks away. We push in on Edward, enraptured by the concept. Edward shovels sand in the nastiest fields, preoccupied with his thoughts. In quiet reverie, he ponders his latest bit of information. A sudden explosion occurs as Edward is shot out of a giant slingshot. Under a full moon, Edward walks up to a dilapidated barn and is about to knock when he notices it's swaying significantly. Yet, Edward knocks anyway, and the swaying and groaning suddenly stop. A beat later, the door handle begins to rattle, seeming stuck. Edward turns the knob, and the door bursts open, knocking him down with a massive white horse, the biggest anyone has ever seen, with blue glowing eyes and a mane of smoke for a tail. Edward wrestles with the beast as its mouth snaps at his throat. Blocking with an arm, Edward tries to push himself free, but the creature’s hooves—holding tight instead of paws—prevent him.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Suddenly, everything slows, and the crowd becomes a mural, causing a young woman to be misplaced in its wake. Now it's Edward who's sprinting, overwhelmed by time, as he peeks in windows while cars zoom in, searching for his fated love. Colossus is waving for a cab, and the last pickup truck slows to let him jump in back. As the truck speeds away, it brushes past a hopeful Edward who believes he'll surely find the girl, the love of his life. Amos kneels down so Karl can sketch a contract on his back and notices Edward dashing into the tent. Amos tosses the contract to a clown, and as Amos begins to stroll away, Edward dashes to join him, gesturing to the bleachers where no backpack seems replaced. Jumping in front of Amos, Edward halts him, and Amos chuckles, entertained. Amos gives a short look at Edward, and ultimately, there's no reason he can refuse, so he nods, and Edward pats Amos's shoulder before he can withdraw the offer. We dive into a montage, where Edward is shown grinning nervously, his head angled to the side, with it cradled in a massive lion's closed jaws, whose dull teeth are just brushing his skin. If the lion blinks, Edward's life is secure. The crowd whispers, making the lion calm, which makes Edward even calmer. With his eyes bright from wakefulness, Edward operates the stilled amusement park ride and dozes off, tumbling backward into the path of the stopped arms. One of the Hydra cars grazes him gently on the shoulder, lowering him down and away, drifting 200 feet along the ground. Amos is strolling past, pauses, glances at the young man, and then finally continues his walk. We pull in on Edward, fascinated by the idea. Edward paints murals in the tidiest stables, consumed with his thoughts. In quiet contemplation, he considers his latest bit of revelation. A sudden implosion occurs as Edward is launched out of a giant slingshot. Under a clouded sky, Edward strolls up to a pristine camper and is about to tap when he notices it's swaying slightly. Yet, Edward taps anyway, and the swaying and silence suddenly commence. A moment later, the door handle begins to shimmer, seemingly fixed. Edward twists the knob, and the door swings open, lifting him gently with a massive black dog, the smallest anyone has ever seen, with red glowing eyes and a wisp of fire for a tongue. Edward dances with the creature as its mouth brushes against his arm. Shielding with a hand, Edward tries to pull himself free, but the creature’s hands—hugging tightly instead of paws—embrace him.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Suddenly, everything rushes, and the orchestra becomes a blur, causing a tall gentleman to be lost in its wake. Now it's Lydia who's frozen, helpless in time, as she checks in mirrors while bicycles pull out, searching for her fated companion. Goliath is thumbing for a ride, and the last minivan stops to let him climb in back. As the minivan pulls away, it passes a dejected Lydia who believes she'll never find the book, the muse of her dreams. Elias leans over so Martha can sign a slip on her shoulder and spots Lydia walking back into the gallery. Elias hands off the slip to a ballerina, and as Elias starts to walk away, Lydia hurries to catch up with him, pointing to the rafters where no violin is to be found. Getting in front of Elias, Lydia stops him, and Elias smiles, amused. Elias takes a long look at Lydia, and ultimately, there's no way she can say no, so she shrugs, and Lydia shakes Elias's hand before she can retract the offer. We move into a montage, where Lydia is shown smiling nervously, her head tilted to the side, with it held in a massive tiger's open mouth, whose sharp teeth are just poking her skin. If the tiger flinches, Lydia's life is in danger. The orchestra applauds, making the tiger antsy, which makes Lydia even antsier. With her eyes droopy from lack of sleep, Lydia mans the whirling festival ride and nods off, falling backward into the path of the spinning wheels. One of the Pegasus wagons hits her square in the chest, throwing her up and away, sailing 200 feet through the air. Elias is walking past, stops, looks at the young woman, and then finally walks away. We push in on Lydia, enraptured by the concept. Lydia shovels oats in the cleanest barns, preoccupied with her thoughts. In quiet reverie, she ponders her latest bit of information. A sudden explosion occurs as Lydia is shot out of a massive catapult. Under a full moon, Lydia walks up to a battered hearse and is about to knock when she notices it's rocking significantly. Yet, Lydia knocks anyway, and the rocking and humming suddenly stop. A beat later, the window latch begins to rattle, seeming stuck. Lydia turns the latch, and the window bursts open, knocking her down with a massive white wolf, the biggest anyone has ever seen, with blue glowing eyes and a lick of frost for a tongue. Lydia wrestles with the creature as its mouth snaps at her throat. Blocking with a leg, Lydia tries to push herself free, but the creature’s arms—holding tight instead of claws—prevent her.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Abruptly, everything cascades, and the forest becomes a swirl, causing an old sailor to be lost in its currents. Now it's Martha who's suspended, stuck in silence, as she gazes in mirrors while bicycles roll in, searching for her elusive treasure. Titan is waving for a boat, and the last fishing vessel halts to let him hop on board. As the vessel moves away, it passes a puzzled Martha who imagines she'll never discover the coin, the jewel of her quest. Cecilia bends down so Liam can sketch a portrait on her back and spots Martha dancing back into the hall. Cecilia passes the sketch to an acrobat, and as Cecilia begins to dance away, Martha scurries to join her, gesturing to the benches where no suitcase is visible. Stepping in front of Cecilia, Martha halts her, and Cecilia laughs, entertained. Cecilia casts a long glance at Martha, and ultimately, there's no way she can refuse, so she nods, and Martha grips Cecilia's hand before she can withdraw the promise. We transition into a montage, where Martha is depicted grinning awkwardly, her head tilted to the side, with it encased in a gigantic wolf's open maw, whose sharp fangs are lightly grazing her skin. If the wolf twitches, Martha's safety is at risk. The audience cheers, making the wolf jittery, which makes Martha even more tense. With his eyes heavy from fatigue, Martha operates the spinning circus ride and dozes off, tumbling forward into the path of the rotating bars. One of the Chiron horses nudges him square in the chest, launching him skyward, soaring 200 feet through the clouds. Cecilia is strolling past, pauses, observes the young lady, and then eventually continues onward. We focus on Martha, captivated by the notion. Martha heaves dirt in the noisome barns, absorbed in her musings. In quiet contemplation, she reflects on her latest revelation. A sudden blast occurs as Martha is propelled out of a gargantuan slingshot. Beneath a crescent moon, Martha ambles up to a dilapidated hut and is about to tap when she perceives it's swaying substantially. Yet, Martha taps regardless, and the swaying and groaning abruptly pause. A moment later, the latch begins to jiggle, appearing jammed. Martha twists the handle, and the door flings open, knocking her down with an enormous red bear, the largest anyone has ever witnessed, with blue shimmering eyes and a flicker of water for a tongue. Martha grapples with the beast as its mouth lunges at her neck. Guarding with an elbow, Martha attempts to push away, but the beast’s claws—clutching firm instead of paws—restrain him.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description:
Suddenly, everything drifts, and the crowd becomes a smudge, causing a young woman to be found in its wake. Now it's Edward who's thawed, confused in space, as he peers in mirrors while bicycles sail out, searching for his destined companion. Colossus is gesturing for a lift, and the last tractor halts to let him hop in front. As the tractor rolls away, it passes a joyful Edward who believes he'll never lose the boy, the passion of his life. Amos crouches down so Karl can sketch a portrait on his back and spots Edward floating back into the castle. Amos tosses the portrait to a juggler, and as Amos begins to skip away, Edward dashes to leap with him, waving to the balcony where no suitcase is to be found. Leaping over Amos, Edward halts him, and Amos grins, entertained. Amos takes a brief glance at Edward, and ultimately, there's no way he can say yes, so he shrugs, and Edward hugs Amos's shoulder before he can withdraw the challenge.

We shift into a vignette, where Edward is shown chuckling shyly, his head leaning to the side, with it stuck in a giant elephant's open trunk, whose rough hide is just grazing his cheek. If the elephant sneezes, Edward's balance is in peril. The audience cheers, making the elephant jittery, which makes Edward even jumpier. With his eyes droopy from lack of energy, Edward operates the spinning carousel and dozes off, tumbling forward into the path of the swaying branches. One of the Hydra balloons bops him square in the chest, launching him sideways and under, gliding 200 feet through the sky. Amos is wandering past, stops, glances at the young man, and then finally strolls away. We zoom in on Edward, captivated by the notion. Edward gathers feathers in the messiest aviary, distracted by his musings. In serene contemplation, he considers his newest piece of understanding. A sudden bang occurs as Edward is released out of a colossal slingshot. Under a half moon, Edward strolls up to a rusted trailer and is about to tap when he notices it's shifting subtly. Yet, Edward taps anyway, and the shifting and murmuring suddenly cease. A beat later, the latch starts to jingle, seeming jammed. Edward pushes the latch, and the door flies open, toppling him over with a massive white rabbit, the largest anyone has ever seen, with blue sparkling eyes and a flicker of rain for a tongue. Edward struggles with the creature as its mouth bites at his arm. Blocking with a foot, Edward tries to roll himself free, but the creature’s fingers—grasping tight instead of claws—hold him.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Abruptly, everyone meanders, and the flock transforms into a haze, causing an elderly man to vanish in its trail. Now it's Martha who's static, powerless in motion, as she peers in mirrors while bicycles glide in, seeking her destined friend. Behemoth is sniffing for a snack, and the final ice cream truck halts to let him scramble on top. As the truck races away, it passes a forlorn Martha who believes she'll never encounter the boy, the companion of her dreams. Iris crouches down so Frank can write a poem on her shoes and notices Martha jogging back into the bungalow. Iris passes the poem to a mime, and as Iris begins to depart, Martha skitters to follow her, pointing to the grandstands where no handbag is discovered. Standing before Iris, Martha halts her, and Iris grins, entertained. Iris takes a lengthy examination of Martha, and ultimately, there's no manner she can refuse, so she sighs, and Martha embraces Iris's foot before she can withdraw the gift. We transition into a sequence, where Martha is depicted grinning timidly, her head leaning to the side, with it enveloped in a colossal elephant's toothy grin, whose blunt tusks are just grazing her neck. If the elephant twitches, Martha's existence is imperiled. The spectators cheer, making the elephant jittery, which makes Martha even more apprehensive. With her eyes drooping from lack of rest, Martha directs the twirling circus carousel and dozes off, toppling forward into the path of the rotating beams. One of the Dragon wagons bumps her square in the chest, launching her up and away, soaring 300 meters through the heavens. Iris is strolling nearby, halts, glances at the lady, and then finally strides forward. We zoom in on Martha, mesmerized by the vision. Martha carries water in the grimiest kitchens, absorbed in her reflections. In silent contemplation, she muses over her recent flash of insight. An abrupt detonation happens as Martha is launched out of a tiny slingshot. Beneath a crescent sun, Martha strolls up to a tattered trailer and is about to ring when she glimpses it's swaying markedly. Yet, Martha rings anyway, and the swaying and murmuring suddenly cease. A moment later, the knob starts to vibrate, appearing seized. Martha twists the latch, and the entry bursts wide, striking her down with a gigantic white cat, the largest anyone has ever witnessed, with purple shimmering eyes and a flash of ice for a tail. Martha grapples with the feline as its jaws snap at her fingers. Deflecting with a leg, Martha attempts to pull herself away, but the animal’s claws—gripping tightly instead of feet—restrain her.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Edward searches desperately for a lost love in a blur of moving crowds and cars. Meanwhile, Colossus hitches a ride, and Amos observes Edward, who is searching for a missing backpack. Amos ultimately decides to help Edward, and they shake hands on a deal. Edward engages in dangerous circus acts, including putting his head in a lion's mouth and getting hit by a ride, causing him to fly through the air. Preoccupied and sleep-deprived, Edward shovels manure and reflects on recent information, only to be suddenly launched from a giant cannon. Under moonlight, he approaches a rocking camper, knocks, and is met by a massive dog with glowing eyes. As Edward wrestles with the beast, it blocks him with human-like hands, stopping him from escaping.

applauds making the lion antsy which makes Edward even antsier A sudden explosion occurs as Edward is shot out of a giant cannon With his eyes droopy from lack of sleep Edward mans the whirling amusement park ride and nods off falling backward into the path of the spinning arms We push in on Edward enraptured by the concept In quiet reverie he ponders his latest bit of information Now it is Edward who is frozen helpless in time as he checks in windows while cars pull out searching for his fated love One of the Hydra cars hits him square in the gut throwing him up and away sailing 200 feet through the air Edward turns the knob and the door bursts open knocking him down with a massive black dog the biggest anyone has ever seen with green glowing eyes and a lick of fire for a tongue Getting in front of Amos Edward stops him and Amos smiles amused If the lion flinches Edward's life is in danger Colossus is thumbing for a ride and the last pickup truck stops to let him climb in back Edward wrestles with the beast as its mouth snaps at his throat Amos leans over so Karl can sign a contract on his back and spots Edward walking back into the tent Yet Edward knocks anyway and the rocking and moaning suddenly stop Amos takes a long look at Edward and ultimately there is no way he can say no so he shrugs and Edward shakes Amos's hand before he can retract the offer We move into a montage where Edward is shown smiling nervously his head tilted to the side with it held in a massive lion's open mouth whose sharp teeth are just poking his skin Suddenly everything rushes and the crowd becomes a blur causing a young woman to be lost in its wake As the truck pulls away it passes a dejected Edward who believes he will never find the girl the love of his life A beat later the door handle begins to rattle seeming stuck

test_cases.name: Rotate Half Paragraph
test_cases.description: One of the Hydra cars hits him square in the gut throwing him up and away sailing 200 feet through the air Amos is walking past stops looks at the young man and then finally walks away We push in on Edward enraptured by the concept Edward shovels manure in the nastiest stables preoccupied with his thoughts In quiet reverie he ponders his latest bit of information A sudden explosion occurs as Edward is shot out of a giant cannon Under a full moon Edward walks up to a battered camper and is about to knock when he notices it is rocking significantly Yet Edward knocks anyway and the rocking and moaning suddenly stop A beat later the door handle begins to rattle seeming stuck Edward turns the knob and the door bursts open knocking him down with a massive black dog the biggest anyone has ever seen with green glowing eyes and a lick of fire for a tongue Edward wrestles with the beast as its mouth snaps at his throat Blocking with an arm Edward tries to push himself free but the creature’s hands—holding tight instead of paws—prevent him Suddenly everything rushes and the crowd becomes a blur causing a young woman to be lost in its wake Now it is Edward who is frozen helpless in time as he checks in windows while cars pull out searching for his fated love Colossus is thumbing for a ride and the last pickup truck stops to let him climb in back As the truck pulls away it passes a dejected Edward who believes he will never find the girl the love of his life Amos leans over so Karl can sign a contract on his back and spots Edward walking back into the tent Amos hands off the contract to a clown and as Amos starts to walk away Edward hurries to catch up with him pointing to the bleachers where no backpack is to be found Getting in front of Amos Edward stops him and Amos smiles amused Amos takes a long look at Edward and ultimately there is no way he can say no so he shrugs and Edward shakes Amos's hand before he can retract the offer We move into a montage where Edward is shown smiling nervously his head tilted to the side with it held in a massive lion's open mouth whose sharp teeth are just poking his skin If the lion flinches Edward's life is in danger The crowd applauds making the lion antsy which makes Edward even antsier With his eyes droopy from lack of sleep Edward mans the whirling amusement park ride and nods off falling backward into the path of the spinning arms
